intro: Aspidium hemiotis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that are adapted for water environments. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and streams. Its rhizomes are submerged, anchoring the plant while absorbing nutrients from the surrounding water. Aspidium hemiotis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
